snippet: Whether “natural” or “artificial,” edible chemicals affect how people perceive taste and smell, an exhibition demonstrates.
abstract: David Arnold, president and founder of Museum of Food and Drink, explains how impending opening of organization’s first permanent home in Brooklyn is merely step towards first-class institution dedicated to food; space, dubbed The Mofad Lab, offers inaugural exhibit Flavor: Making It and Faking It; hands-on display of taste and smell testings explores history of flavor additives and reveals surprising facts like cow dung is used to make artificial vanilla.
